intro: Wedelia diversipapposa, commonly known as the velvetleaf wedelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with a velvety texture and a distinctive reddish-brown underside. Its small, yellowish flowers are borne in clusters and bloom from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open woodlands due to its adaptability and rapid growth.
